Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    represents a junction in a rectangular grid
    used by Grid and GridNavigator In calculating shortest path, Node has the responsibility of deciding if it should be added to the end of the list in Grid

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int _distance
      shortest distance from destination set by reset(), newDistance()
      private int _x
      row and column index of my location in grid
      private int _y
      row and column index of my location in grid
      static int BIG 
      private boolean blocked
      set by blocked()
      (package private) Node[] neighbor
      array of neighboring nodes, in order of direction

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Node(int x, int y)
      allocate a new Node at location x,y in the Grid

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void blocked()
      node is now blocked; distance to destination is BIG
      int getDistance()
      Returns the length of the shortest path to the destination
      Node getNeighbor(int direction)
      returns the neighboring node in the direction null if it does not exist
      int getX()
      Returns the x coordinate
      int getY()
      Returns the y coordinate
      boolean isBlocked() 
      boolean newDistance(int distance)
      updates distance if parameter d is smaller than current value, in which case return true
      indicating node should be added to list.
      void reset() 
      java.lang.String toString() 
      void unblocked()
      resets blocked flag, used for testing.
